item.title: Military aircraft crashes into Texas residential area
item.description: A military training aircraft crashed on Sunday in a residential neighborhood of Lake Worth, Texas, injuring at least two and damaging homes, authorities said.

item.title: Stockpiled COVID vaccines must be handed to poorer nations, says former UK PM
item.description: A vaccine summit being hosted by US President Joe Biden must come up with a plan this week to transfer 100 million stockpiled COVID-19 vaccines to poorer countries before they reach their expiry date, former British Prime Minister Gordon Brown said.

item.title: Pateros mayor sees no discrimination, human rights violation in yellow ribbons for COVID-positive houses
item.description: Pateros Mayor Miguel "Ike" Ponce III on Monday said he sees no discrimination or human rights violation in having yellow ribbons placed in front of houses with COVID-19 cases in the municipality.

item.title: No DOH recommendation yet regarding COVID-19 jabs for minors --Vergeire
item.description: There is no recommendation yet from the Department of Health (DOH) regarding the vaccination of individuals 12 to 17 years old againstÂ COVID-19, Undersecretary Maria Rosario Vergeire said Monday.

item.title: Mga kaso ng COVID-19 sa Camarines Norte, tumaas pa; provincial hospital isolation ward, puno na
item.description: Umakyat na sa 2,280 ang bilang ng mga tinamaan ng COVID-19 sa lalawigan ng Camarines Norte nitong Sabado, ayon sa datos ng Department of Health Bicol Center for Health Development.

item.title: World leaders return to UN this week with focus on pandemic, climate
item.description: World leaders are returning to the United Nations in New York this week with a focus on boosting efforts to fight both climate change and the COVID-19 pandemic, which last year forced them to send video statements for the annual gathering.

item.title: Growing California wildfire spares group of giant sequoias, including world s largest tree
item.description: A group of landmark giant sequoias has so far been spared by a blaze sweeping through a California national park, authorities said on Sunday.

item.title: Canada s Trudeau hammers rival over COVID-19 stance on last day of campaign
item.description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, crisscrossing the country making a last pitch to voters before Monday's election, said on Sunday only his Liberals could end the COVID-19 pandemic and accused his main rival of taking the wrong approach.

item.title: Key data on US J&J, Moderna COVID-19 boosters weeks away, Fauci says
item.description: Data needed to determine the advisability of booster shots of the Moderna Inc and Johnson & Johnson COVID-19 vaccines is just weeks away, President Joe Biden's chief medical adviser, Dr. Anthony Fauci, said on Sunday.

item.title: Over 2 million Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine doses arrive
item.description: More than two million doses of the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine arrived in the Philippines late Sunday night.

item.title: Qatar flight with Afghans, Americans, Europeans leaves Kabul, official says
item.description: A fourth chartered flight carrying civilians from Afghanistan to Qatar since US forces withdrew last month left Kabul on Sunday with more than 230 passengers, including Afghans, Americans and Europeans, a Qatari official said.

item.title: India reports 30,773 new COVID cases as it seeks to welcome back tourists
item.description: India on Sunday reported 30,773 new coronavirus infections in the past 24 hours, taking the total to 33.4 million, as it seeks to reopen the country to overseas tourists.

item.title: Volcano erupts on La Palma in Spain s Canary Islands
item.description: A volcano erupted on the Spanish Canary Island of La Palma on Sunday, sending lava shooting into the air and streaming in rivers towards houses in two villages from the Cumbre Vieja national park in the south of the island.

item.title: OVP s vaccine express back in Pasig
item.description: The Office of the Vice President's (OVP) vaccine express was back in Pasig City on Sunday for the second dose vaccination of A4 residents, with Vice PresidentÂ Leni Robredo in attendance.

item.title: Protesters call to kick out Thai PM on coup anniversary
item.description: Anti-government protesters hold up the three-finger salute by the Democracy Monument during a demonstration to mark the 15-year anniversary since the 2006 military takeover in Bangkok on September 19, 2021, as they urge the resignation of the current administration over its handling of the COVID-19 coronavirus crisis. Jack Taylor/ AFP
